page.title: 19Kiplin Hall
page.content: {Kiplin Hall}is a charming Jacobean country house,set in quiet countryside between Scorton and Great Langton.Its history and architecture are extremely interesting. Kiplin Hall was built for George Calvert about 1620.George Calvert was 1st Lord Baltimore and founded the State of Maryland,USA.The house was built to a unique design that is outstanding amongst British architecture of the 17th century. Miss Bridget Talbot established a { {Charitable Trust}in 1968 inorder to preserve Kiplin Hall for the public to enjoy .She died in 1971 and the present trustees were bequeathed the contents of the house. Kiplin Hall is open to the public who can enjoy its parkland and lake,picnic area,caravan site and quiet woodland walks.
